photo.title: Irene and Frédéric Joliot-Curie, 1944
photo.description: The MoMA exhibit also includes many of the portraits the photographer made of the leading lights of the twentieth century: In addition to the Joliot-Curies, who were awarded the Nobel Prize for chemistry in 1935, he shot Henri Matisse, Truman Capote, Albert Camus, and Carl Jung, to name a few.
